alert.note: Alert for Barry; Lawrence (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 04 at 7:41PM CDT until November 05 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Barry County in southwestern Missouri... South Central Lawrence County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 145 AM CDT Saturday. * At 741 PM CDT, Rainfall gauge reports indicated showers and thunderstorms producing moderate to heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen, with a report in Purdy of 2.1 inches. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Gauges reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Monett, Aurora, Purdy, Wheaton, Verona, Butterfield, Pioneer, Mcdowell, Pleasant Ridge and Ridgley. This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway C, Center Creek at County Road 2220, Shoal Creek at Farm Road 2110 and North Fork Clear Creek at Nellie Avenue. FLASH FLOOD...GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
